byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: Taliban claims responsibility for shooting and killing Wasil Ahmad, 10-year-old boy hailed as hero by Afghan government for leading militia defense against Taliban siege of Khas Oruzgan District in 2015; incident points to continued exploitation of child soldiers by government and militants, despite Pres Ashraf Ghani's ban on children in military.
lead_paragraph: The former child soldier, Wasil Ahmad, was killed near his family’s home less than six months after he had fought to end a Taliban siege and was publicly — and illegally — celebrated.

headline.main: Taliban Gun Down 10-Year-Old Militia Hero in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: A Combat Veteran, Killed in the Fourth Grade
